_meanings:
{@--4@} To favour, promote,
animate. (In the Dhātupāṭha 
several other meanings are assigned
to this root, but they are very
rarely used in classical literature;
{%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#gati, kAMti, avagama, praveSa, SravaRa#}, 
{#svAmyarTa#} or {#sAmarTya, yAcana, kriyA, dIpti, avApti#},
{#grahaRa, vyApti, AliMgana, hiMsA, AdAna, dahana#},
{#BAva, BAga#} and {#vfdDi#}).

To 
consume, devour. --WITH {#anu#} to 
encourage, inspire.

{1} to regard,
attend to. {2} to wait for. {3} to 
promote, impel.

{1} to cherish,
behave friendly towards. {2} to 
encourage.

{1} to satisfy, satiate. {2}
to protect, maintain. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%aveo%}].
